job description:
Description

Interprets data, analyzes results, and uses statistical techniques to improve efficiency and operations of current programs; turns data into information and ultimately business decisions for the City of Longview; and performs other job related duties as assigned.

Examples of Duties

Interprets data, analyzes results using statistical techniques, and provides ongoing reports. Develops and implements data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. Acquires data from primary and secondary data sources. Identifies, analyzes and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets. Filters and corrects data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and update code problems. Works with management to prioritize business and information needs. Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities. Performs other related duties as assigned or required.

Minimum Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Geography, Statistics or related field, and two years data analysis experience; OR an equivalent combination of education and experience. Required Licenses or Certifications: Must possess a valid Texas Driver's License. Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS) Certification is required within one month of employment. National Incident Management System (NIMS) Certification is required within one year of employment.

Physical Demands/Work Environment

Work is performed in a standard office environment. Subject to sitting, standing, walking, bending, reaching, and lifting of objects up to 10 pounds.
